projects.name: Boxinator
projects.description: Need a box? Order a box!
projects.overview: Fullstack assignment during Noroff training period. You can order mysterious boxes and you will receive email confirmations for each step. Admins are able to update details and statuses of shipments. Project was made by a group of 4 developers.
features: Authorization-based views to allow access based on user roles
Email confirmations for shipment claim, creation and delivery
contributions: Collaborated on design decisions to align with project goals and client requirements
Responsibility of frontend architecture and design choices
Took primary responsibility for implementing the majority of the frontend features and functionality
Developed and maintained the frontend CI/CD pipeline to automate deployment processes

projects.name: Pokemon Trainer
projects.overview: Sort of pokedex for browsing and keeping a track of Pokemons that you've encountered. Angular assignment during frontend training period by Noroff.

projects.name: Translation app
projects.description: Turn text into American Sign Language.
projects.overview: Type in text and receive corresponding ASL interpretation. React assignment during frontend training period by Noroff.
features: Receive matching presentation in hand signals

projects.name: Movie Characters API
projects.description: API for storing movies, characters and franchises. Full CRUD functionality
projects.overview: In this project I designed and implemented database based on requirements. Fully functional API was built also. Backend assignment during Noroff training period.

projects.name: Amandus
projects.description: Robot Framework web editor and integrated git environment on the go
projects.overview: This software engineering project was developed by a team from the University of Helsinki for Eficode. Our task was to enhance an existing platform by implementing additional features based on the client's needs. The software allows users to synchronize repositories from GitHub, GitLab, and Bitbucket, enabling seamless editing of Robot Framework test files directly within the editor. The editor supports all standard Git operations, including handling and resolving merge conflicts. The project was carried out by a team of six developers, each contributing over 200 hours of work, while adhering to best practices in agile development.
features: Repository Synchronization: Sync repositories from GitHub, GitLab, and Bitbucket for seamless integration
Advanced Git Operations: Perform all common Git operations such as push, pull, clone, merge, and branch creation directly within the editor
Robot Framework Editing: Edit Robot Framework test files with full support from the integrated language server
Merge Conflict Resolution: Handle and resolve merge conflicts directly in the editor
contributions: Implemented OAuth flows for seamless authentication with Git services
Designed and integrated new components into the existing interface
Developed and executed end-to-end tests using Cypress to ensure system reliability
Created mock versions of Git services for testing purposes
Set up and maintained the CI/CD pipeline using GitHub Actions and Docker for continuous integration and deployment

projects.name: Rate a repository
projects.description: Browse and rate repositories on your Android phone
projects.overview: Retrieve repositories from GitHub. You can leave a review and rating for an repository, as well as, see reviews left by other users. Sign up for the app is required. This is the course exercise for FullStack Open part 10.
features: Rate, leave review & read other's reviews
contributions: End up with functional React Native Android app
